alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN HOCKING AND SOUTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Chillicothe, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Gibisonville, Mooresville, Lake Logan State Park, South Bloomingville, Richmond Dale, Enterprise and Rockbridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
